attributes.action: Government must publish a Carers' Strategy and not a Carers’ Action Plan
attributes.background: I am one of the 7 million unpaid carers in the country. You can read about me here http://bit.ly/2lGLpxc (Guardian web link) I took part in a government consultation for unpaid carers in early 2016. Carers have been waiting for a Government Strategy ever since.  I know unpaid carers deserve better.
attributes.additional_details: Like 6,500 other carers, I spent time providing evidence for government on our caring role. It was expected that government would publish the results in a Carers Strategy by the end of 2016. Nothing has happened since the consultation closed. In October 2017, I was quoted in a debate in Parliament https://goo.gl/vN27L2 (Parliament web link). An Action Plan was recently mentioned but an Action Plan is not a Carers' Strategy. Signing this petition will show government that carers matter.

attributes.action: Change the NHS 24 week revival rule
attributes.background: Currently doctors and hospital staff are under no legal obligation to help babies born before 24 weeks gestation, even though the youmgest baby to be born and survive was born at just 21 weeks.  Sign to give more babies a chance to survive and live full lives.
attributes.additional_details: 4 years ago my son was born at 20 weeks gestation, he was born alive and fought for his life for 2 hours before taking his last breath, he was given absolutley no medical help, and was just left in a cot to die because of this rule. I'm sure there are many more cases like mine, and there shouldnt be any more! The bottom line of a hospitals job is to keep people alive when they enter it that way, and premature babies are no different, if they are born alive they should be helped to stay alive!

attributes.action: Urge Israel to stop the deportation of African refugees to third countries.
attributes.background:
Dear Friends,
We are alarmed by the Israeli Government’s plan of deportation; if not reversed the refugees could face abductions, enslavement, torture, and death trying to reach Europe.

We urge you to sign this petition. 
Committee of Eritrean Unity for Justice – UK.
attributes.additional_details:
We are urging the UK Government to use its diplomatic clout to persuade the Israeli Government to stop deporting, the refugees and provide them protection under the UN Convention Article 33 (1) “No Contracting State shall expel or return a refugee in any manner whatsoever [...]”

Further detail see the link below https://storage.googleapis.com/wzukusers/user-28803632/documents/5a724e7fdb1ffzxNoqTu/Petition%20to%20stop%20the%20illegal%20deportation%20of%20African%20Refugees%20in%20Israel.pdf

attributes.action: Abolish the Solicitors Regulation Authority
attributes.background: We already have the Legal Ombudsman to protect the Public Interest. The Police and Fraud action cover any crimes. The fees generated by the SRA should be paid to the Government to set up an independent, fair and balanced body.
attributes.additional_details: A group of solicitors are now forming an action group as there is a real concern smaller firms may be being targeted by insurance giants who may be using the SRA to ensnare the smaller firms in tangles of red tape that handicap their ability to represent the general public against the insurance giants. This risks preventing access to justice for the public who can’t afford to pay a bigger law firm.

attributes.action: The Government MUST NOT let the ECJ override British justice after Brexit
attributes.background: Theresa May is considering giving the ECJ a role in Britain once it has left the EU. She held talks on a referral system for European citizens who remain in the UK. Judges in the UK would refer cases to Luxembourg should queries crop up that have not been addressed during Britain's membership.

attributes.action: Make Food and Farming education in UK schools part of the curriculum
attributes.background: Children and young people are becoming more disconnected than ever from where their food comes from or how it is produced. Is it right that out of 27,500 children 1/3 thought cheese was made from plants? Additionally, 1/4 thought fish fingers were made from chicken or pork. (BBC News, 2013).
attributes.additional_details: Food production represents the single largest human use of land. Why is food production not part of the curriculum? The increasing influence of social media can lead to dramatic lifestyle changes and criticism, often based on myths surrounding farming practices and confusion with those which happen outside of the UK. Informed choices can only be made if food and farming education becomes part of the curriculum in all UK schools in order to deliver unbiased facts to children and young adults.

attributes.action: Revise current Care Order categories for adoption breakdowns.
attributes.background: Often adoption disruptions take place due to factors outside of the adopter’s control, such as previous trauma that the child has experienced and the lack of support that is available to adopters. Adoption disruptions rarely take place due to a lack of love or because the adopter is abusive.
attributes.additional_details:
In order for the local authority to gain parental responsibility of a child (whether from adopters or birth parents) they must evidence that the child is/ or likely to suffer significant harm due to either emotional, sexual, physical, neglect or mental abuse. 

If an adoption disrupts due to no fault of the parents or child, this does not fall into any of the above categories of abuse yet the social worker must still pick one. Therefore the current system is unfit for purpose.

attributes.action: Continue to recognise and allow the Inbound European Au Pair program post Brexit
attributes.background: We, the undersigned and BAPAA, are greatly concerned that the UK government has not prioritised the importance of Au Pairs to the British economy during the Brexit negotiations.  Our formal representations to government ministers have been ignored and yet Au Pairs are vital to the British economy.
attributes.additional_details: Thousands of hard-working parents rely on European Au pairs to enable them to juggle their work life balance.  Au Pairs receive pocket money and live as part of a family to experience British culture and family life and to learn English. This affordable program provides UK families with flexible childcare and enables young Europeans to study English and be introduced to British values at no cost to our government.  Brexit must ensure the continuation of this valuable cultural exchange programme.

attributes.action: Independent review of appointments to Office of Students board
attributes.background: The OfS has responsibility for putting “the student interest at heart” and promoting fair access to HE. Therefore we request an independent review of the appointment process to the board to assure it has been transparent, recruited the best qualified & meets public duties under the Equalities Act.
attributes.additional_details: Given the importance of Higher Education to a prosperous and democratic society, it is important that it is appropriately regulated. This requires a board that understands the sector and is committed to furthering the pursuit of knowledge across all disciplines and for the support of all members of society. Expertise should be drawn from outside and from within the sector. The exclusion of academic and professional services representatives and of a member of the NUS is of particular concern.

attributes.action: Halt immediately UK arms sales to Turkey until they withdraw from Afrin Syria.
attributes.background:
Turkish aggression against the Kurds of Afrin is in breach of the UN charter and the UKs signitor responsibility to uphold the Charter.
It is acknowledged the vital support Kurdish Forces have given, in the fight against IS to the UK.A just settlement for the Kurds is a requirement of peace

attributes.action: Keep freedom of movement for UK and EU Citizens as part of Brexit EU trade deal
attributes.background: The Leave side won the EU referendum in 2016, but there are voters on both sides who wish to keep EU freedom of movement rights post Brexit.  Freedom of movement is also essential for the NHS and companies across the UK and EU, we must fight to maintain it. Please sign if you agree.
attributes.additional_details: As the March 29th 2019 Brexit withdrawal deadline draws ever closer we must act before it's too late to save Freedom of movement rights for UK and EU Citizens post Brexit.  Think about the future and the opportunities that EU freedom of movement rights offer with the ability to work, live, study and retire across the EU 28.

attributes.action: Reduce the foreign aid budget and increase police funding from the savings.
attributes.background: The government proposes increases in council tax to raise £450m extra funding for the police.  Sign this petition if you want the government to reduce foreign aid to cover this cost rather than to further increase our taxes.
attributes.additional_details: In compliance with UN guidelines, the government spends 0.7% per annum on foreign aid, which equated to approximately £12bn in 2015.  Much of this goes toward slush funds and dubious projects in which we, the taxpayer, currently have no say.   This is our money, thus we demand a say.

attributes.action: Schools to have mental health and disabilities a part of the curriculum
attributes.background: For ages I have and many others I know, have said that learning about health issues and disabilities should be part of the curriculum taught in schools. It could help limit if not stop the stigma and bullying.

attributes.action: The UK Government to introduce a ban on all non-recyclable packaging from 2022.
attributes.background:
We call for action due to environmental crisis caused in the main by single-use plastics and demand the Government commit to an outright ban; most importantly in the food industry. 

We also call on the Government to set a target date for eradication of  non-degradable toxic plastics before 2030.
attributes.additional_details:
Single-use plastics can be eliminated by introducing bottle deposit schemes, pollution taxes and the removal from sale of all plastic bags, including 5p schemes.

Plastic use has impact on a global scale as recent articles have highlighted. It has to stop now!

https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2016/nov/14/uk-to-investigate-human-health-impact-of-microplastics

https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/mar/12/microplastic-pollution-in-oceans-is-far-greater-than-thought-say-scientists

attributes.action: Right to remain for 18+ who have lived in the country since they were minors
attributes.background: Grant the right to remain in the UK and Republic of Northern Ireland to 18+ Immigrants currently without legal status to remain in the country, who have lived in the country as minors, completed their A level qualifications and are now unable to progress further into Higher Education.
attributes.additional_details: There are many brilliant, gifted, intelligent, responsible and upstanding 18+ in the country that are unable to progress further into higher education and/or employment because the lack of a legal status limits them. Haven been shown concern by the government until they legally became adults (i.e. Bus pass and free education), it is such let down to these young adults who (without having a say in being brought to the UK or Northern Ireland) now often find it almost impossible to move on in life

attributes.action: Give mothers and fathers 50/50 custody of children in separation or divorce.
attributes.background: Fathers are just as important to the health development of children. Often limiting a father's access affects a child more than is realised creating societal and mental health issues for the child later in life. Don't make children decide between parents but have a balanced upbringing.
attributes.additional_details: Currently men generally only receive every other weekend in the courts and many use their children as a weapon to hurt fathers, when in fact children are being hurt. Men are considered second class citizens with mothers stating fathers must "win their children over" when mums have to make no effort. Children are used to inflict pain on another part and its not fair on the child to be in this position and having to take sides. I propose to give equal access and go to court for more as in the USA.

attributes.action: Fund Slow Down For Horses and Horse Awareness Adverts on Television
attributes.background: We see adverts warning drivers of the dangers of speeding. A horse is a live animal, unpredictable in most surroundings and traffic. We need adverts to highlight this with stories and evidence to hit home. Horse riding has become more popular which is resulting in more accidents and even deaths.

attributes.action: The government should introduce a truly FAIR funding formula for all schools.
attributes.background: The current funding of schools is unfairly distributed meaning that some schools receive millions of pounds more than others.  A "fair" funding formula was to be introduced for schools but this was dropped, leaving many schools underfunded due to lower real terms funding (i.e. due to inflation etc).
attributes.additional_details:
Some additional funding was given recently but is outweighed by inflationary pressures (increased costs) and additional government requirements.  Schools in some areas are either having to make redundancies or are using up remaining cash reserves.  This is therefore a looming crisis that the government must address before this impacts further on outcomes.

All references to funding made above are "per pupil" and take account of separate funding such as the pupil premium and London weighting.

attributes.action: End homelessness in Britain by adopting and funding the "Housing First" project.
attributes.background: There are over 9000 homeless people living on the streets of Britain. Many are ex military men and women suffering from mental health issues. No one chooses to be homeless. Britain can and should eradicate homelessness. The "Housing First" model has already proven to reduce homelessness in Europe.
attributes.additional_details: Finland adopted the "Housing First" model in 2008. To date Finland is the only European country to see homelessness numbers falling. The model is simple: Provide a home first, treat the causes of homelessness and help people to retrain and get back into work and reintegrate into society. Not only is "Housing First" cost effective but it is morally the "right thing to do". Many MP's already support "Housing First". By supporting this petition you could force a parliamentary debate.

attributes.action: A Bomber Command Campaign Medal honouring those who served
attributes.background: My Great Uncle lost his life as a pathfinder during WW2, we have no campaign medical for them; we had to raise the money for a memorial to those who served. It is disgusting that their efforts have NEVER been recognised.
attributes.additional_details:
Bomber Command Memorial Group, Bomber Command History Forum. 
Wilfred Cyril Riches RAF (V) DFC & bar pathfinder killed on ops 5/6th July 1944

attributes.action: Immediately boost NHS funding by around £5bn a year from adding 1p to Income Tax
attributes.background: When my own 3-year-old broke his leg, the hospital said he needed a wheelchair but they could no longer afford them. Our 8-year-old son had to join a two year waiting list for an autism assessment. For the sake of all children in the UK, the NHS urgently needs more funding.
attributes.additional_details: It’s a policy that has previously been put forward by the Liberal Democrats, and was backed by a group of senior health professionals at the time including Sir David Nicholson, who led NHS England for almost a decade, and the previous heads of the Royal College of General Practitioners and also the Royal College of Psychiatrists.

attributes.action: End entirely the BBC's self-regulating complaints procedure.
attributes.background: The BBC is currently in charge of it own complaints procedure. Only after three phases can a complaint be referred to Ofcom. I have, on multiple occasions, complained about BBC content from television and radio and not once has my complaint been upheld.
attributes.additional_details: I have requested statistical details of how many complaints are given rulings in favour of the complainant and no information has been provided. The BBC should not be able to self-regulate in this way. It is funded by the TV Licence fee and the tax payer and should therefore be accountable to its audience. The BBC should not be self-regulating and all complaints should be made directly to Ofcom. Ofcom should provide a comprehensive response to the complainant and full statistical transparency.

attributes.action: Regulate the eyelash extension industry making training compulsory
attributes.background: Let’s make our lash industry safe, by regulating it we avoid non trained individuals to practice without a license. This would minimise the risks of lash and eye damage

attributes.action: Urge the FCA to cap repayments on rent-to-own and doorstep lending
attributes.background: The Sun is calling for a cap on the total cost of rent-to-own loans and doorstep lending at double the original item price or loan amount. This was introduced for payday loans in 2015 and the numbers of people struggling with unmanageable debts to those lenders has more than halved.
attributes.additional_details:
People on the lowest incomes, living in the poorest places, are paying a poverty premium - around 7 million people have resorted to high-cost credit. People whose wages or benefits don't stretch far enough need to borrow from rent-to-own or doorstep lenders to help pay for things such as an unexpected bill or to furnish their homes. These come with exorbitant rates of interest - more than 1,500% in some cases of doorstep lending. 
It's time to stop the credit rip-off.

attributes.action: The Nursing & Midwifery Council (NMC) should be a tax-payer funded organisation
attributes.background:
The NMC has been an independent regulatory body, funded by Nurse's & Midwives. 
The main aim of the NMC is to protect patients, whilst regulating practice of Nurse’s and Midwives.
I feel the NMC should be funded by the tax-paying public and not by N&M's, like the Health & Safety Executive is.
attributes.additional_details:
The NMC recently decided to pay their staff an 11% annual pay rise & we are still fighting to get above 1%!
In September 2017, it was reported by the BBC News Online: Fourteen unions joined together to ask for the increase, (3.9%!!), saying pay has fallen by 15% since 2010, once inflation was taken into account. 
How can the NMC justify a £120 annual retention fee, to an organisation, whose primary remit is to protect patients, & have got a massive pay rise?? 
I have colleagues using food banks!

attributes.action: Exclude drone 'freestyle/racer' pilots from future drone usage restrictions.
attributes.background: The many 'near miss' drone incidents reported in the media involve drones requiring little skill to fly and piloted by inexperienced individuals. Restrictions would unfairly affect pilots of 'freestyle/racer' drones, which haven't been involved in such an incident to date.
attributes.additional_details:
The following 'drone incident' links all concern 'photography' drones.
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39747042
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-39457371
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2016/nov/17/drone-came-within-5-metres-of-passenger-jet-at-liverpool-airport

Below is some info on drone racing.
http://smashingdrones.com/what-is-drone-racing/
Most racers are >250g, so are affected. Drone racing is highly skilled and its DIY culture would make registering each drone unfeasible.

attributes.action: Ask the Government to order Sunderland to create a new Local Plan
attributes.background: The council is proposing a local plan which focuses development on the periphery using only Greenfield and Greenbelt sites. We challenge the assumptions and methodology of the plan. The supporting Greenbelt deletion document had only 14 consultees out of a population of 275000. We demand a new plan.
attributes.additional_details:
We want a new plan to replace the proposal which:
- properly consults about any Greenbelt changes
-considers and prioritises Brownfield sites
-uses accurate population projections and methodologies
-has sustainable transport at its heart
-promotes and protects green spaces as important for communities
-values the individual identities of each community involved

This is an especially urgent case because the council's plan is so flawed. Delay will waste considerable public funds.

attributes.action: To instigate signage and digital displays directing to the nearest defibrillator
attributes.background: Studies show that the public are often not aware of where the nearest defibrillator is should a cardiac arrest occur.  Although provided with directions when making a 999 call, the person may not have local knowledge.  Precious time could be wasted in locating the defibrillator.
attributes.additional_details:
Cardiac charity SADS UK believes community defibrillators should have signposts to direct people to quickly access this lifesaving equipment.  Roadside signage posts could be used, also digital information boards at bus shelters and rail stations.
Initially 999 must be dialled to despatch the ambulance; the rescuer uses directions given to locate the nearest defibrillator. Rescuers seeing a sign giving directions to the defibrillator will be assured they are heading in the right direction, saving precious minutes in reaching the defibrillator.

attributes.action: All British goods and produce to be clearly marked with the union flag
attributes.background: Many Patriots would prefer to buy British, it helps British business and many people home and abroad believe British is best but it is often difficult or impossible to identify British goods.
attributes.additional_details: With Brexit on the horizon we should be doing all we can to promote British goods.

attributes.action: Stop plans to cut Cannon Street trains on the Hayes (Kent) train line
attributes.background: Following a government consultation on the future of south eastern rail services, the secretary for State for Transport is recommending that companies bidding for the south eastern train franchise should make their bid based on the proposed change to cut services to Cannon Street from 2022.
attributes.additional_details: The Hayes line would in future run to London Bridge, Charing Cross and Victoria. The paper states that the ‘ small number of passengers who currently travel to Cannon Street, would need to change at London Bridge’.  The trains to Cannon Street are already extremely busy with no seats available by the time the trains reach Catford. Cutting the services would have a huge impact on local commuters, not only increasing their travel time but also further overcrowding at London Bridge.

attributes.action: Please do not increase the IHS paid by migrants coming to the UK to £400
attributes.background:
We are asking Parliament to please consider the real impact this increase is going to have on families of British Citizens who are already struggling to pay for visas fees.
This increase will cause more broken families.
attributes.additional_details:
The IHS fee is paid on top of visa application fees, which are already extremely expensive. Such fees have thousands of families broken around the world because the British Citizen simply cannot afford to pay the cost of bringing his/her family to the UK.
Currently, immigrants pay £200 per year as an Immigration Health Surcharge (IHS) to contribute towards the cost of running the NHS. The government has announced that this fee will increase to £400 per year.

attributes.action: UK Government shouldn’t enact legislation permitting another Scottish referendum
attributes.background: As Alex Salmond stated in 2014, time and time again, “this independence vote is a once in a generation vote.” Yet, come 2016, the SNP are at it again, striving to gain independence from this UK. As a generation equates to 32 years, let us make sure that they cannot seek indyref2 until at least 2046.

attributes.action: Legislate that all UK constitutional referenda must have a super majority
attributes.background:
Legislate that all UK future constitutional referenda (like Brexit & Scotlands Independence ref) must have a super majority of at least 60% to effect change. Furthermore there should be a minimum 75% turnout.
Enacting this legislation would ensure there was a clear irrefutable majority for change.
attributes.additional_details: The purpose of the change is to embed the principle of a real and unarguable will for change in law & the constitution. Both recent UK referendums has caused untold division within society & has caused attention post these referendums to be focused on that division rather than than more critical & essential matters of state & local politics.

attributes.action: Backdate the removal of stamp duty for first time buyers to April 6th 2017
attributes.background: It was announced today that there will be the removal for stamp duty for first time buyers will immediate effect.  For those first time buyers who bought prior to 22nd November 2017, they will be at a disadvantage.  Backdate the removal to the beginning of this year's budget changes.

attributes.action: Extend to UK citizens the family rights guaranteed for EU citizens in the UK.
attributes.background: In the Brexit negotiations, family rights for EU citizens were guaranteed including the right for non EEA family members to join them in the UK. This should be extended to include UK citizens who must meet income thresholds, huge visa fees + complex rules before non EEA family members can live here
attributes.additional_details:
We support the family rights of Europeans in the UK.
But currently UK citizens must earn £18600 to bring a non EEA spouse or partner to the UK. This rises by £3800 to bring a child here + £2600 for each subsequent child.
UK citizens must pay thousands of pounds of visa fees and the Immigration Health Surcharge for our non EEA family members.
If we make any mistakes on our visa forms our family members must leave the UK and appeal from overseas. 
We demand parity with European citizens in the UK.

attributes.action: Require any driver with points on their licence to have Black Box Car Insurance
attributes.background:
With over 1,700 people dying and over 180,000 injured on our roads every year, and with 80% of drivers breaking the 20mph speed limits, bad driving has created a huge cost to society.

The Black Box Car Insurance policy significantly modifies driver behaviour making them into model drivers.
attributes.additional_details:
A driving licence is a licence to drive motorised vehicles on our roads after demonstrating competence at driving and knowledge of the Highway Code. 

Drivers with points on their licence have demonstrated they are driving poorly. Black Box technology can educate a bad driver to become a good driver and highlight bad driving. This is shown by the low premiums being offered to young drivers by black box policies. 

Banned drivers should have a lifetime requirement to use Black Box Insurance.

attributes.action: Make Changing Places mandatory in the large public places listed in BS 8300:2009
attributes.background: Changing Places provide all the equipment that severely disabled people need, such as ceiling hoist, adult sized changing bed, centrally placed toilet, and adequate space. Changing Places are RECOMMENDED in BS 8300:2009, but should be mandatory so disabled people can be equal members of society.
attributes.additional_details: BS 8300:2009 RECOMMENDS that Changing Places should be built in large public places such as Shopping Centres, airports, leisure centres, sports stadiums, town halls, and auditoria, to name but a few. Disabled people often have to be changed on dirty toilet floors which is degrading, unhygienic and dangerous. Many disabled people choose to stay at home because the facilities they need do not exist in their community. Changing Places should be mandatory as they are a necessity for severely disabled people.

attributes.action: Return Tax raising powers in Scotland to the UK Government
attributes.background: The Scottish Government is planning a new rise in income tax. It already imposes a different threshold for taxation at the higher rate to the rest of the UK. Tax raising powers should be returned to the UK Government to make taxation in Scotland equal.

attributes.action: I call on the government to change the legislation on assisted dying
attributes.background: I've been living with Motor Neuron Disease (MND) for 12 years, I'm unable to use my arms and hands, and have muscle wastage round my neck, I can't wash, dress or feed myself, however, there is a possibility that one day I could be paralysed from the neck down, unable to talk or Swallow.
attributes.additional_details: whilst I'm happy getting on with my life. If the time come when I was paralysed from the neck down, unable too talk or swallow, then I wouldn't want to continue  living, and I think it's my right as an individual to have the opportunity to die with dignity helped by a doctor, it shouldn't be impossible for politicians to create legislation that gives me that right, but also protects the weak and vulnerable in society

attributes.action: Scrap smart motorways and bring back permanent hard shoulders.
attributes.background: When your vehicle has issues on a motorway, you look for the relative safety of the hard shoulder. Smart motorways have removed that safety and are not smart enough to recognise lane 1 blockages quick enough. As a consequence, lives can be put at imminent risk!
attributes.additional_details:
As a HGV driver, I struggled to understand completely the concept of a smart motorway. If there was no hard shoulder to stop on, what happens next? 
The answer, after pounding the smart tarmac, is ... it isn't smart enough. It isn't quick enough to put lane restrictions/closures in place. It is in fact....a death trap! Emergency services take longer to reach an incident due to no empty lane. It doesn't work!

attributes.action: Lower the voting age to 16
attributes.background: The voting age should be lowered to 16 because I think that people are responsible enough to know what they are voting for and they are deciding their future. 16 year olds are eligible to enlist in the army but are not allowed to vote for who makes the decisions that change their future.

attributes.action: Pay teachers for the the time they spend on placements in schools
attributes.background: Trainee teachers are required to spend significant time working in  schools without pay. They are relied on as full members of staff and should be entitled to at least minimum wage. Due to this commitment, they are unable to hold another job and often live on a loan of around £4,000 per year.
attributes.additional_details: The government offers bursaries for secondary school positions for those in certain areas or with certain qualifications. Working full time in a school severely limits the trainees to gain a secondary job to provide supplementary income. Primary trainees are eligible for student finance, which provides a very limited income and has to be repaid. Their service to a career path so important for our next generations deserves at least minimum wage. Please sign this petition.

attributes.action: Make Postural Awareness with Pilates and Yoga part of the Secondary Curriculum.
attributes.background: The digital age has a huge impact on teenage posture, cognitive processes, emotional stability and physical health.  This results in an increase of immune, digestive and respiratory deficiencies, behavioural problems and Mental Health.
attributes.additional_details:
We are proposing a multidisciplinary holistic program which brings together the most valuable benefits of Pilates, Yoga, natural movement and mindfulness.  Our Programme aims to support teenagers in developing their anatomical strength changing their cognitive processes from negative to positive improving their emotional stability, behaviour and overall health.

‘Much effort is put into educating children’s minds but teaching them how to use their bodies is often ignored. This is an opportunity to give teenagers lifelong skills on how to look after their bodies’ - David Meyer, Head Teacher.

attributes.action:
Stop incineration of any waste which could be recycled. 
No new incinerators!
attributes.background: Incinerators are fuelled with domestic and commercial rubbish that has not had everything recyclable or biodegradable taken out e.g. food waste and plastics. We want 1. Legislation to stop waste of material resources. 2. Waste reduction, reuse and recycling to be made absolute top priority in law.
attributes.additional_details:
Incinerators (known as gasification, pyrolysis, EfW, ATT or ACT plants) produce air pollutants. These are a concern for public health: https://laqm.defra.gov.uk/assets/63091defraairqualityguide9web.pdf

A cross party Early Day motion signed by 19 MPs calls for a moratorium on incineration: https://www.parliament.uk/edm/2017-19/581

We ask that p.94 of this plan be put into law:    https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/673203/25-year-environment-plan.pdf):

attributes.action: Make Puppy farming a criminal offence
attributes.background: A puppy farmer is a breeder who breeds puppies with little or no regard for the health and welfare of the puppies or their parents. Once the puppies are born, they are separated from their mothers at 4 weeks old. After, the bitches are given dangerous injections for them to go back into heat
attributes.additional_details:
Health of puppies sold by puppy farmers:
20% of puppies (four times more than the average) bought from pet shops or directly from the internet suffer from parvovirus, an often fatal disease which can cost up to £4,000 to treat (2014 Kennel Club PAW survey).

With no regulations, puppy mills have no cleanup control. This means that dogs can be living in urine and feces for indefinite periods of time.

Puppy mills have no veterinary care, climate control, or protection for the animals from weather

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory training in autism for all NHS mental health services.
attributes.background:
1 in 68 people has an ASC. 
Over 50% of autistic people have depression. 
They are 28 times more likely to exhibit suicidal thoughts/behaviours. 
There is difficultly in accessing support, and staff are insufficiently trained. According to NAS, Transforming Care implementation needs improvement.
attributes.additional_details:
Because of the additional need for support, all mental health services are guaranteed to treat some autistic patients. However, many staff have no training in this whatsoever.   

Even basic training would have an immediate impact on helping autistic people engage with services effectively. 

Inpatient mental health care should be viewed as our last line of defence. Therefore it is imperative that these staff have, at minimum, a basic understanding of autism spectrum conditions.

attributes.action: Bring carers allowance into line with jobseekers allowance.
attributes.background: People who are full time carers for loved ones can apply for carers allowance which the government recognise as working 35 hours per week caring for someone. Yet despite this carers get less money per week than people who are unemployed and are not eligible for any discounted travel.
attributes.additional_details:
People who are full time carers for loved ones can apply for carers allowance which the government recognise as working 35 hours per week caring for someone. Yet despite this carers allowance is set at £62.70 per week and are not eligible for any help in the form of discounted travel cards. However a person who is unemployed gets £73.10 and who has been for a period of 13 weeks gets a bus pass for duscounted travel. 
How is this fair??

attributes.action: Reduce The Minimum Income Requirement for Spouse Visa
attributes.background: Government should reduce the minimum income requirement for British spouse visa, from £18,600 to £14,400. In many jobs, a person can save a lot from their monthly income and can provide for two people (themselves and the spouse) without relying on public funds. The incomes are lower outside London.
attributes.additional_details: Many British citizens working in the UK on slightly lower pay, especially outside London. They’re employed and the income they earn are enough to provide for themselves and the spouse. The government should consider this. In Scotland, Wales or Northern Ireland, the income rates are lower than England.

attributes.action: Leaving the Single Market should be subject to a parliamentary vote
attributes.background: Article 127 of the 1994 EEA Agreement states Each Contracting Party may withdraw from its Agreement provided it gives at least twelve months' notice in writing to the other Contracting Parties.
attributes.additional_details: "Immediately after the notification of the intended withdrawal, the other Contracting Parties shall convene a diplomatic conference in order to envisage the necessary modifications to bring to the Agreement". Because the UK is a separate 'contracting party', leaving the European Union does not automatically result in a cessation of EEA membership. As a result,   because British EEA membership is enshrined in UK law through Parliament's 1993 Agreement Act, then triggering Article 127 requires parliamentary approval before it can be formally triggered.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to wrongly describe food as gluten free
attributes.background: I have coeliac disease which means if I have gluten I can be violently ill. I have been given gluten more than 3 times in 3 separate restaurants and cafes. On one occasion a paramedic was called as mine and my friends spaghetti's were mixed up by the waitress. I was violently ill for over 2 hours.
attributes.additional_details:
Gluten free has become quite faddy and coeliac disease has fallen under the shadow of that.
There is a huge lack of education and sometimes full questioning and reassurance is needed in a restaurant before ordering and even then mistakes happen.
being glutened causes damage for about a week. Coeliac is an autoimmune disease not an intolerance.
